title: Academic Integrity Guidelines
content: Maintaining academic integrity is a fundamental requirement for this coursework. Students must adhere to the highest standards of honesty and originality in their submissions. Any form of misconduct, including plagiarism, will not be tolerated.

guidelines.description: All submissions must be your own work. Collaboration is not allowed unless explicitly permitted. Sharing or copying solutions will be treated as a breach of academic integrity.

Plagiarism involves presenting someone elseâ€™s work or ideas as your own, without proper acknowledgment. This includes copying from peers, online resources, or other materials. Proper citations and references are mandatory for any external content used.

Students are encouraged to explore AI tools and resources, but misuse, such as directly copying outputs without understanding or credit, is strictly prohibited. Ensure that all such uses are clearly documented.
All code submitted must be written by you. Using third-party libraries or frameworks is allowed, provided they are properly credited and do not constitute the primary solution.
If group work is permitted, contributions of each member must be clearly documented. Free-riding or misrepresenting contributions is considered misconduct.

reporting.procedure: If you suspect academic misconduct, report it to the course coordinator. All reports will be handled confidentially.
